website_summaries.verdict: A professional quality cutter that comes with 4 different blade sizes and will help you turn out restaurant-quality fries at home.
pros: This is a heavy-duty slicer that cuts through potatoes, sweet potatoes, and other vegetables with ease
It comes with 4 different blades so you can choose how thick you want your fries
cons: To keep it from slipping while you cut, you have to either mount it or purchase suction cup feet separately

customer_reviews.title: This thing is heavy duty. I bought it so ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy duty. I bought it so I could cut larger potatoes than the one I had and it sure works. If you are not going to bolt it down or fix some way so it is immovable then buy the suction cups (they don't come with it) I can not hold it still while using on big potatoes so I ordered the suction cups. This thing makes serious French fries!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Poplin

customer_reviews.title: i made fries non stop for the first two weeks ...
customer_reviews.text: i made fries non stop for the first two weeks. its pain to assemble especially when mine came with no instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: This works fine for regular (white) potatoes
customer_reviews.text: This works fine for regular (white) potatoes. I bought it hoping to be able to slice sweet potatoes with it and have been moderately successful at that. The small cutter will not work at all on sweet potatoes. The medium cutter will work as long as the sweet potato is cut in quarters the long way and then in half across it. Placing the quarters in the slicer with the small end towards the blades allows me to slice them. I'm OK with this, but I can't quite give it a five because of it. It does seem to be well-made and very sturdy. It would have been nice to have rubber feet included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Restaurant Style cutter!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this thing is awesome! It's bulky but it works great. Got the Rubber feet to stick to the counter and it works great. We've had potatoes every day this week! It's great for carrots, sweet potatoes, etc. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, large, hard to manipulate & store
customer_reviews.text: It's got some power, but only if it's bolted down. Freestanding it's not a one person job. Have to have one person hold down while the other does the lever. It doesn't like big potatoes, nor will it work for raw sweet potatoes, which I was really hoping for. I like all the different sizes. So long as you rinse it right after use it's not too difficult to clean. It's large and cumbersome, though, to store and use. I'm not really willing to attach it to my wall, though.
customer_reviews.author: MVHop Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cuts!!
customer_reviews.text: Really nice but my husband always has to pull the lever! I’m not strong enough. Had to purchase counter grips and he still has to do it for me. Cuts down the time SO much if making homemade fries!!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: White potatoes cut very easily with this. Had a lot of trouble with sweet potatoes. I think the wedge or largest grate may have worked better for the sweet potatoes, but we ended up doing them by hand. However this fry cutter got the job done for our picnic.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: This item works better that we had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: My husband grows potatoes and last year we had more than we knew what to do with so, we decided to cut, chop, mask and shred the potatoes. This item works better that we had hoped for. Love the hash brown size cutting blade!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Ann Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Poor design!
customer_reviews.text: In my experience this is pretty useless and a pain to properly assemble. I returned it for several reasons. - it won’t cut even a small potato unless you put the weight of your entire body on it. - even if you manage to cut a potato, you will think that you should have just used a knife and be quicker. - if the black plastic plate is not exactly aligned with the blade, you will notice small pieces of black plastic on your potatoes, as the blade also slices pieces of the plastic away. Disgusting.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very well build product and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very well build product and very easy to use. It takes some force to get through a potato with the small screen attachment but that's to be expected. I can see myself using this for years to come. I would not waste the money on the suction cup feet for this, go to Lowes or Home Depot and buy some bolts to hard mount it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Seemed nice and sturdy in the pictures, but was cheap when arrived. Must be bolted down to function properly! Takes a screwdriver to change blades! Hard to assemble! I returned this.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy it does not work
customer_reviews.text: Before even attaching the handle it was difficult to move the press. Had to loosen the wing nuts on the removable cutter to even move it fully. I suspect it is slightly bent. Installed handle and tried an Idaho potato and it was extremely difficult and on one potato impossible to run through the cutter. Very dissatisfied as with all the cutters included I thought it would be a great purchase. I am sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Menides

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty fry cutter
customer_reviews.text: This fry cutter comes with several die cutters and they all work well. A well, heavy made fry cutter that we use all the time.
customer_reviews.author: danleep11

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!
customer_reviews.text: we use it all the time as we love home made french fries! we hung it on the wall and it is great to be able to just walk over and bam we have french fries!!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: A Ton of Uses
customer_reviews.text: This did not come with the suction cups. So to use it, I mounted it on the wall. It works well in this way. I have cut avocados and lemon wedges, as well as diced onions in a breeze. Getting the remnants out of the guards is sometimes difficult. The blades were easy to clean and we're sharp. I'm gonna really like this!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Monceaux

customer_reviews.title: Won't cut a whole potato.
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a good product but when I'm using the medium blades I still need to cut a potato into quarters in order to cut the fries. It just doesn't have enough leverage. I also bought the rubber feet, which keeps it from sliding around. But that just added to the money I wasted. I can't return it because I don't have the original box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but with issues
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with long potato. Must cut in half. OK for me but if you want long fries, this is not the unit for you. Once you get past half the length of unit, you can't operate the handle because of the angle to cut anything. Ay 1/2 it works very well and is OK for me. Also you need to keep a screw driver handy to change the blades.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Flamand

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out you can't just sit a potato in there and shred it. You actually have to put the potato directly in the center and voila.
customer_reviews.author: inhere

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great but would like the parts to be able to removed without a screwdriver to clean
customer_reviews.author: terry stanley

customer_reviews.title: I lost 2 washers to lock in place the pins  now what??
customer_reviews.text: I e-mailed support directly Friday night Monday morning they replayed asking what model and what parts i needed . i found them 35 minutes later so they were not needed now . great support and product works great as well .
customer_reviews.author: Raymond S.

customer_reviews.title: Need muscles to push potatoes through!
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy. The only thing I didn’t like was it’s hard to push the potato through. You need a lot of muscle strength - I purchased separately suction cups they should have came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was obtrusive
customer_reviews.text: The instructions weren’t clear on how to assemble it, and it’s too big to store in a lot of cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: Working great. Bought a cheaper one and had to return it. This one is great. Love the ability to change sizes! Cuts apples great too for apple fries!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The blades have come apart. Very hard to use ...
customer_reviews.text: The blades have come apart. Very hard to use. I guess it's more for commercial use and bolted to a table.
customer_reviews.author: Twilight

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy one just for sweet potatoes.
customer_reviews.text: Great for everything except sweet potatoes. I do find it somewhat easier if I lubricate the blades with spray cooking oil. I am a pretty strong person and I have to quarter the large sweets. I am afraid of dulling the blades.
customer_reviews.author: SBJim

customer_reviews.title: Good but need improvement on stability .
customer_reviews.text: This machine is very good . the only downside on it is that it has no sunction on the base to keep it from moving when using it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Youmbi  S. M

customer_reviews.title: When ordering this you also need to order the suction feet as well.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best potato cutter ever. I wish it would come with the suction feet
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: I don’t buy this again
customer_reviews.text: Looks easy to but is very hard to cut the potatoes. Not sharp enough.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Contrary to advertisement, this does NOT cut Sweet Potatoes.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to cut sweet potatoes and I was afraid that if I pushed the potato through, I would break the machine. It will not cut a sweet potato.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bussiere

customer_reviews.title: I returned product
customer_reviews.text: Instruction booklet was poorly written and illustrations were hard to follow. Product hard to use
customer_reviews.author: Robin W. Caudle

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Unable yo to assemble or return. waste of money, so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Primevere Charles

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a great cutter but the handle is too short.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Landry

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend some type of stabilizer for the feet tho
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered so many things thru Amazon in the last couple of months. This was the only thing on time and definitely worth it. I would recommend some type of stabilizer for the feet tho. We're going to order the suction cups to see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal L Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product for the price and different size cutting blades
customer_reviews.author: Herbert R Partsch Jr

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Well Designed Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a commercial level product which is very well designed. Can even make quick work of sweet potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Far2bz2p

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It works for turnips too!! We can a lot of food and this item is used for much more than making fries out of potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Burrow

customer_reviews.title: Push block no resistant
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cuter on October having problem with the scew when we change the push block
customer_reviews.author: tony atallah

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this, just short of restaurant quality. But for home use at the price great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great cuts fries effortlessly
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly. Was exactly as described. Works great cuts fries effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Potter

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, if you have the strength to push that potato through. Took much longer to use this then it would have if I would just cut them with a knife.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty cutter
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job. It needs to be mounted on a work surface in order to work which I didn’t know when I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for  sweet potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting sweet potatoes, easy to use, mounted it to my cabinet, love it
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for white potatoes only does not work for sweet potatoes
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is so good for cutting fresh potatoes and making french fries.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Richard

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THOSE FRENCH FRIES
customer_reviews.text: GOOD QUALITY WORKS GREAT BUT GET HUBBY TO USE IT
customer_reviews.author: robert erwin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is great we have used twice and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Phillips

customer_reviews.title: a lot of pull for large potatoes
customer_reviews.text: took a lot of force to get large potatoe through it
customer_reviews.author: Scott Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for my husband and it works really well. It arrived as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Bishop

customer_reviews.title: ... have cook outs with friends every weekend and they love it
customer_reviews.text: We have cook outs with friends every weekend and they love it
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Hargrave

customer_reviews.title: Woks very good, get the large suction cups too
customer_reviews.text: Woks very good , get the large suction cups too.
customer_reviews.author: God

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Should have a dropper built into the cap to control the amount you are adding to the epoxy.
customer_reviews.author: Dean M. Roadifer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I wanted to make my own fries. I put a potato in there and even though I bought the suction feet to hold it in place, I could not exert enough strength to actually cut the fries with the die in place. I had my husband try and he couldn't get it to cut the potato either.
customer_reviews.author: TxGirl

customer_reviews.title: Looks amazing! Thought "WOW
customer_reviews.text: Looks amazing! Thought "WOW! I found the perfect kitchen chopper!" NOT! I just tried to chop a bell pepper and it would not cut through it! Doesn't make sense to me for $69.
customer_reviews.author: Denise R. Becknell

customer_reviews.title: A big disappointme
customer_reviews.text: I found this French fry cutter difficult to use. I was not strong enough to push potatoes through the cutter without precooking them. Even zucchini had to be microwaved to get them to push through.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... this with the intention of using it to make sweet potato fries
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of using it to make sweet potato fries. It failed horribly on the sweet potato. The furthest it cut into the potato was about an half of an inch. I'm a strong male that weight trains so I can only image someone not so strong trying to use this.
customer_reviews.author: KH

customer_reviews.title: ... I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE BUT PRODUCT LOOKS JUST LIKE THE
customer_reviews.text: IT GETS THE JOB DONE BUT NOT AS DURABLE AS I THOUGHT IT WOULD BE BUT PRODUCT LOOKS JUST LIKE THE PICTURE
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Tedious changing attachments.
customer_reviews.text: Works well even with larger potatoes. The different attachments are difficult to change out with multiple screws and wing nuts to remove and replace, otherwise I would have given it 5 stars. Works best if it were bolted to wall and used vertically. I'm a big guy and it's hard to get the leverage to cut a potato 15 times in one push. If it were bolted to the wall, you could have better leverage if you pull down.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmyj71

customer_reviews.title: Works great, makes yummy fries!
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts fries! Works for other veggies as well but we primarily use it for fries. Get the good suction cups with it and it doesn't move at all when cutting. Easy to change the blades and we've used them all with great success. You do have to give it a good healthy quick push, don;t try to "baby" it - you won't get a full-size potato through the smaller grids. If you aren't strong, cut the potato in half and then use this to make the fries. Love the wedge size - works great for frying or pan fried American fries.
customer_reviews.author: Rodduc

customer_reviews.title: A Butter knife is sharper
customer_reviews.text: 1) If you don't bolt it down you CAN'T USE IT. 2) 75lbs of pull to cut a zucchini I bought this to make my life easier and to have fun eating potato wedges. Even the baby potatoes are impossible to slice. DO NOT BUY IT! IT'S THE WORST KITCHEN TOOL EVER! I've worked in a restaurant with one of these and potatoes went through it easily and squash was even easier! I had to mount this to a wall and HANG from it to cut a squash. I wish I had never bought this.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Assembly difficult and cleaning push is problematic
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because it had different sizes for cutters. They work fine, but I prefer to wash after each use. Disassembling the pusher section is problematic because it requires screwdriver...wing nuts would have made it much easier. The assembly of the lever section was ridiculous...why would they use a pin and yoke assembly. The yoke is quite difficult to release.
customer_reviews.author: Davey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cut without extreme effort, if it cuts at all
customer_reviews.text: We have tried different kinds of potatoes, pre cutting them, and we bought the suction cup 'feet' to go with this product, as other reviews suggested; yet this product is super difficult to cut potatoes with. Difficult as in it rarely cuts a potato straight through. The potato gets most tries. We had many men and women try, justcto see if it was us and if we were just using it wrong, and all had trouble getting it through. We wanted to love it and we were super excited about it, but we ended up kind of hating it and definitely regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: C Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Best deal for our family. ...
customer_reviews.text: Sweet heavy duty built quality , comes with 4 different sizes for your fries & veggies, I searched for days reading reviews & doing research, this was the best choice I found,,, how many cheep fry cutters do U have to brake before you'll allow yourself to get the real deal cutter...
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Grabil

customer_reviews.title: but this one is the absolute best by far
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several vegetable slicers, but this one is the absolute best by far. My only suggestion is that you cut the ends off of the potatoes and do small, even strokes on the potato to get it through the slicer. Also, be sure to buy the suction cups that go with it. Well worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Be sure to order the foot pads for it as it slides on counter tops without them.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: blades break it sucks
customer_reviews.text: who ever welds the plates into it sucks poor welding soo blades break out. broke the potato slicer third time I used it. complete waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Rod Moneysmith

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give this product a 5 star rate but I noticed when I opened the box that there are no screw to mount it and no instruction to put it together. Also the pin that holds the handle is very hard to take out.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Navasca

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: It seems good quality but one of the blades came damaged in the mail no good! Was it used and returned or just defective? I hope it wasnt used and returned!!!
customer_reviews.author: HammerMan

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter
customer_reviews.text: Great cutter but definitely needs to be mounted. I read about the suction cups you can buy but I can’t believe they would work that well. I believe the answer is mounting it vertically. To each his own though.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Stebbins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. Works real easy with potatoes and fruit. It's real easy to clean as well. I also bought the suction cups to hold it in place and it stays right in place. I'm so glad I bought the commercial one as I'm afraid the cheaper way to go wouldn't of lasted long.
customer_reviews.author: Airedale Mom

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Stable, Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful potato slicer. It is sturdy and moves easily. It is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bakesalot

customer_reviews.title: Could not ask for more.
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected and more. I use it to cut deli meat end for soups and stews. Works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product easy to assemble and disassemble. Easy to use and makes great fries.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T.

customer_reviews.title: Need to fix to something that allows you to really ...
customer_reviews.text: Need to fix to something that allows you to really put on the pressure. I have only used for potatoes so far and it makes light work of 5 lbs of potatoes. Does require some strength.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Loved it! Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Restaurant quaility, works great for making home cooked fries! Buying the Suction cup feet makes it so much easier to use!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara St.Clair

customer_reviews.title: Buy the rubber suction cups. You will need them ...
customer_reviews.text: Buy the rubber suction cups. You will need them. This is hard to operate so u need both hands.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Treesh

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: Good construction. Works awsome. The only reason it doesnt get a 5 is because you have to buy suction cups separately to hold it to the countertop otherwise you will never get the potatoes cut i to fries. When they are needed for normal operation it should come with the product
customer_reviews.author: bryan burks

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty and makes French fries so quickly.  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to use as well as being industrial. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dale F Follin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great cutter, you will need the feet if used on counter
customer_reviews.author: Ronny Cowart

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes you just need to smash a lot of food.
customer_reviews.author: DPP

customer_reviews.title: Solid and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Great cutter. Sometimes we have to 1/4 the potatoes so that it is easier to work the lever. I made a wood base with a lip that hooks over the table edge. That way it is portable, but when using it, the device won't move. We've been using the smallest cutter die to make french fries.
customer_reviews.author: DRU

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We bought it to make sweet potato fries and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bubberoo

customer_reviews.title: Well made...but make sure you...
customer_reviews.text: Well made just remember to add the rubber feet if you are not planning to screw this into your kitchen counter. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: french fry cutter
customer_reviews.text: Love the product and a very easy to deal with vender !
customer_reviews.author: scott siskavich

customer_reviews.title: Great french fry cutter!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent french fry cutter. I found if you center the potato, pull just enough to begin the cutting process and then give it a quick forcefull pull, you can cut the whole potato. It also helps to anchor the cutter to a larger board that will help keep the cutter securely in place or purchase the optional feet that are available. Washes up easily with hot water. Will save me many hours slicing french fries for my family! Would highly recommend. While it does come with an apple slicer, it does NOT core the apple. This need to be changed in future version or make available an apple corer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Junk junk junk
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this. I followed all the instructions and I just did not work. Two of us were trying to hold to the table and put peeled potatoes into the machine for over two hours with no success. And they still have not filed my return label after two weeks of emails! If you’re interested in getting ripped off by all means by this. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Not only for Potatoes
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. It's not only good with potatoes it also works great at Thanksgiving and Christmas cutting up turnip. Saves a lot of time. Got the suction cups which I would highly recommend unless your going to mount it somewhere. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Shea

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended, but harder than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you order the suction cup feet or it will be very difficult to use on a counter. Requires a bit of force to use. Microwave sweet potatoes a bit first to soften.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperMJ

customer_reviews.title: having to yank on the handle two or more times to force the potato or sweet potato through the slicer
customer_reviews.text: I expected this to make slicing french fries easier. While it DOES accept a much larger and thicker potato than home slicers, it isn't any easier to use, having to yank on the handle two or more times to force the potato or sweet potato through the slicer.
customer_reviews.author: Shamyn Whitehawk

product_meta.title: Goplus French Fry Cutter Fruit Vegetable Potato Slicer Commercial Grade W/ 4 Different Size Stainless Steel Blades 1/4", 1/2", 3/8" and a Round Blade
product_meta.description:
With this French Fry Cutter, you will enjoy restaurant style French fries in your own kitchen without all the slicing and dicing. It includes four sharp stainless-steel blades which can help to slice the potato into pieces to let you make tasty French fries without any hassle. Also it is perfect for other root vegetable such as turnip, yam, sweet potato, carrot, eggplant, lettuce etc and fruit such as apple. Besides, it is ideal for professional food processing factory to process preserved fruit, pickles, canned food and food in bags. It is quite a good helper for fast food restaurant, canteen, dinning halls and home to prepare French fries and potato chips food.

Feature

Brand new and durable, easy for installation, easy cleaning
Made of stainless steel and aluminum alloy steel, anti-corrosion
Ideal for both commercial and home use
Heavy duty cast iron body
304 Stainless steel blades, aluminum alloy knife rest, long service life
Blade sizes: 1/4", 1/2", 3/8" and 4th blade for slicing oranges and apples (8-cut)
Handle designed ergonomically, efficiency is much more than common manual processing
Sturdy legs provide more stability while mounting the cutter on any flat surface
Small volume does not take up much space on your countertop
Extra Long lever for maximum push with minimum effort
Fully mountable wall or table, can also stand on its own without mounting

Specification

Blade sizes: 1/4", 1/2", 3/8" and the 4th blade for slicing oranges and apples (8-cut)
Dimension: 15''x7'' x9”
Net Weight: 10lbs
feature_bullets: 【4 Sizes of Blades】Sizes of three square blades are 1/4", 1/2" and 3/8", ideal for making different sizes of French fries and cutting vegetables such as sweet potato and carrot. The round blade can be used for cutting fruits like apples, perfect for making wedges.

【Stainless and Anti-Corrosion Material】The cutter is consists of anti-corrosion 304 stainless steel blades, heavy duty iron body and aluminum alloy handle, which makes the whole set durable and stable. A long service life span is guaranteed.
【Less Effort Needed】Handle designed ergonomically, which not only makes the cut work safe but also effort-saving. It helps ingredients easily through the sharp stainless steel blades.
【Space Saving and Easy to Clear】Small volume does not take up much space in your kitchen and easy to clean with water, never be worried about rinsing and rust, use the cutter easily.

【Stable and Better Use】Equipped with sturdy legs, our french fry cutter provides more stability while mounting the cutter on any flat surface. Enjoy 4 sizes super sharp blades, for making thin to very thick fries.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars210 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
